org.knime.core.node.port.database

Class StatementManipulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.port.database.StatementManipulator

  • public class StatementManipulator
extends Object
    This class lets you manipulate SQL statement by adding database-specific parts or changing statement parameters. Subclasses may override some methods and change the manipulation. All implementations must be thread-safe.
    Since:
    2.10
    Author:
    Thorsten Meinl, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland

      protected static Pattern SAVE_COLUMN_NAME_PATTERN
      Pattern for matching any column name that needs no escaping.

    • Method Detail

      • limitRows

        public String limitRows(String sql,
                        long count)
        Modifies the incoming SQL query so that the number of rows is limited. The default implementation uses the LIMIT clause.
        Parameters:
        sql - any valid SQL query
        count - the maximum number of rows
        Returns:
        an SQL query

      • randomRows

        public String randomRows(String sql,
                         long count)
        Parameters:
        sql - A valid SQL query
        count - The number of rows to take randomly
        Returns:
        a SQL query
        Since:
        3.1

      • forMetadataOnly

        public String forMetadataOnly(String sql)
        Modifies the query so that it does not return any rows. This is usually used for just getting the result's metadata from the database.
        Parameters:
        sql - any valid SQL query
        Returns:
        an SQL query

      • createTableAsSelect

        public String[] createTableAsSelect(String tableName,
                                    String query)
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to create
        query - the select statement
        Returns:
        the sql statement that creates a table with the given name from the given sql query
        Since:
        2.11

      • dropTable

        public String dropTable(String tableName,
                        boolean cascade)
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to drop
        cascade - true if the cascade option should be used
        Returns:
        the statement to drop the given table
        Since:
        2.11

      • quoteIdentifier

        public String quoteIdentifier(String identifier)
        Quotes an identifier e.g. column or table name if it contains characters that need quoting e.g. white spaces.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier to quote
        Returns:
        the identifier, possibly quoted
        Since:
        2.11

      • quoteColumn

        @Deprecated
public String quoteColumn(String colName)
        Deprecated. use quoteIdentifier(String) instead
        Quotes a column name if it contains characters that need quoting e.g. white spaces.
        Parameters:
        colName - the column's name
        Returns:
        the column's name, possibly quoted

      • getValidColumnName

        public String getValidColumnName(String colName)
        Replaces all characters that are not supported by the database in identifiers with supported characters.
        Parameters:
        colName - the name to convert into a valid db column name
        Returns:
        the given name with all characters replaced that are not supported by the database
        Since:
        2.10

      • unquoteColumn

        public String unquoteColumn(String colName)
        Unquotes a column name from database metadata. Most databases don't need unquoting, but some drivers return column names with quotes.
        Parameters:
        colName - the column's name
        Returns:
        the column's name, unquoted

      • setFetchSize

        public void setFetchSize(Statement statement,
                         int fetchSize)
                  throws SQLException
        Sets the fetch size on the statement. Note that some database specific implementation need to modify connection properties such as auto-commit, therefore you should save and restore the connection state around this commend.
        Parameters:
        statement - a statement
        fetchSize - the fetch size; a negative value indicates that the fetch size should not be set explicitly.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs, this method is called on a closed Statement

      • getTempTableName

        protected final String getTempTableName()
        Returns a random name for a temporary table.
        Returns:
        a random table name

      • getPivotStatement

        public String getPivotStatement(String tableName,
                                List<String> groupByColumnsList,
                                Map<DataColumnSpec,Set<Object>> pivotElements,
                                List<Pair<String,DBAggregationFunction>> aggValues,
                                PivotColumnNameGenerator pivotColGenerator)
        Returns a SQL statement for pivoting.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Input query
        groupByColumnsList - Name of columns used for GROUP BY
        pivotElements - Columns and corresponding elements used for pivot
        aggValues - Aggregation columns and corresponding functions
        pivotColGenerator - Column name generator
        Returns:
        result SQL Statement for pivoting
        Since:
        3.1

      • getSamplingStatement

        public String getSamplingStatement(String sql,
                                   long valueToLimit,
                                   boolean random)
        Returns a SQL statement for sampling.
        Parameters:
        sql - Input SQL query
        valueToLimit - Number of rows to take
        random - true, if rows are selected randomly
        Returns:
        a SQL statement for sampling
        Since:
        3.1

      • getBinnerStatement

        public String getBinnerStatement(String query,
                                 String[] includeCols,
                                 String[] excludeCols,
                                 Map<String,List<Pair<Double,Double>>> boundariesMap,
                                 Map<String,List<Pair<Boolean,Boolean>>> boundariesOpenMap,
                                 Map<String,List<String>> namingMap,
                                 Map<String,String> appendMap)
        Returns a SQL statement for binning
        Parameters:
        query - The input query
        includeCols - Names of columns that are binned
        excludeCols - Names of columns that are not binned
        boundariesMap - Map containing limits of bins as values
        boundariesOpenMap - Map containing boolean which indicates if edge is open (true) or closed (false)
        namingMap - Map containing names of bins as values
        appendMap - Map containing names of columns that should be appended as values (can be null).
        Returns:
        a SQL statement for binning
        Since:
        3.1
